platforms.name: MONAI
platforms.description: MONAI is an open-source, PyTorch-based framework specifically designed for developing deep learning applications in medical imaging. It provides domain-optimized tools, transforms, and pre-trained models to accelerate research and deployment in healthcare, such as for segmentation, registration, and classification tasks. Its unique value lies in its strong community-driven focus on reproducibility, interoperability with clinical standards like DICOM, and its specialized libraries for handling the unique challenges of 3D/4D medical data.
keyFeatures: Domain-specific transforms for medical image pre-processing (e.g., intensity normalization, spatial cropping for 3D volumes)
Specialized network architectures for healthcare (e.g., UNet, DynUNet, SegResNet) with pre-trained models
Integrated support for medical data standards (DICOM, NIfTI) via MONAI Label and MONAI Core

platforms.name: CellProfiler
platforms.description: CellProfiler is a free, open-source software platform designed for quantitative analysis of biological images, particularly from microscopy. It enables biologists and researchers without deep programming expertise to create robust, automated image analysis pipelines for tasks like cell segmentation, object counting, and feature measurement. Its unique strength lies in its modular, user-friendly interface combined with powerful, peer-reviewed algorithms developed at the Broad Institute, making high-throughput, reproducible image analysis accessible to the life sciences community.
keyFeatures: Modular pipeline builder with drag-and-drop interface
Over 90 built-in modules for image processing, object identification, and measurement
Integrated machine learning for pixel/object classification (CellProfiler Analyst)

platforms.name: PathML
platforms.description: PathML is an open-source Python toolkit designed specifically for computational pathology, enabling researchers to process, analyze, and extract insights from whole-slide images (WSIs). It provides a unified pipeline for preprocessing (e.g., tiling, staining normalization), feature extraction (handcrafted and deep learning-based), and seamless integration with popular ML frameworks like PyTorch and TensorFlow. Its unique value lies in its modular, extensible design tailored for high-throughput pathology workflows, bridging the gap between raw histopathology data and machine learning-ready datasets.
keyFeatures: Modular preprocessing pipeline for WSIs (tiling, staining normalization, artifact removal)
Integration with openslide and libvips for efficient slide reading
Support for handcrafted feature extraction (e.g., morphological, texture features)

platforms.name: BUSClean
platforms.description: BUSClean is an open-source Python library specifically designed for the pre-processing and knowledge extraction of Breast Ultrasound (BUS) images to support medical AI development. It provides specialized tools for filtering scans, detecting anatomical views and measurement calipers, and extracting structured annotations like BI-RADS labels from DICOM metadata and image pixels. Its unique value lies in creating a standardized, clean dataset pipeline for a challenging medical imaging modality, directly addressing data quality issues that hinder AI model training in breast cancer analysis.
keyFeatures: BUS scan filtering to identify and isolate valid breast ultrasound images from mixed DICOM directories
Dual-view detection (Left/Right breast) and view type classification (e.g., transverse, sagittal)
Automatic caliper detection for identifying measurement annotations placed by sonographers
